poem:
Title: "In Spotlight's Birth"

A man's ink births a stage,
Where giants live, though he is silent.
Animated in sinewy prose, whispers of past rise.
A chronicler says to redemption, we look
and find Dahl in shadow beneath Lithgow's glance.
Paper-thin, a caricature now paints a man,
Layers of truths marred by controversy.
Who will say, if theatre's floor
won't echo with misguided zeal, rather than creativity?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "John Lithgow to star in Royal Court play about Roald Dahl’s antisemitism His bestselling children’s books are regularly turned into hit plays and musicals but now Roald Dahl’s personal life has inspired a new drama. John Lithgow, best known for the TV comedy 3rd Rock from the Sun, will star as the author in Giant, written by Mark Rosenblatt and directed by Nicholas Hytner at the Royal Court theatre in London this autumn. “I’m thrilled". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
